sen.j: 久原 房之助 （くはら ふさのすけ、1869年7月12日（明治2年6月4日 (旧暦)） - 1965年1月29日）は、戦前日本の実業家、政治家。
sen.e: Fusanosuke KUHARA (July 12, 1869-January 29, 1965) was a Japanese businessman and statesman before the war.
Fusanosuke KUHARA (July 12, 1869-January 29, 1965) was a Japanese businessman and statesman before the war.
Fusanosuke KUHARA (July 12, 1869-January 29, 1965) was a Japanese businessman and statesman before the war.

sen.j: 日立製作所創立の基盤となった久原鉱業所（日立銅山）や久原財閥の総帥として「鉱山王」の異名を取った。
sen.e: He was also called "Kozan ou" (king of mining industry) for bening a president of Kuhara Kogyosho (Hitachi copper mine), which later became Hitachi, Ltd. and Kuhara Zaibatsu.
He was also called "Kozan ou" (king of mining industry) for bening a president of Kuhara Kogyosho (Hitachi copper mine), which later became Hitachi, Ltd. and Kuhara Zaibatsu.
He was also called "Kozan ou" (king of mining industry) for bening a president of Kuhara Kogyosho (Hitachi copper mine), which later became Hitachi, Ltd. and Kuhara Zaibatsu.

sen.j: 又、政界にも進出した。
sen.e: Moreover, he went into politics.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Moreover, he went into politics.
Moreover, he went into politics.

sen.j: 逓信大臣、立憲政友会（久原派）総裁を歴任し「政界の黒幕」と呼ばれた。
sen.e: He served as the Minister of Communication and the president of Rikken seiyukai (Kuhara group) and was called "power broker of the political world."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: He served as the Minister of Communication and the president of Rikken seiyukai (Kuhara group) and was called "power broker of the political world."
He served as the Minister of Communication and the president of Rikken seiyukai (Kuhara group) and was called "power broker of the political world."

sen.j: 生涯
sen.e: Biography
Biography
Biography

sen.j: 青年期まで
sen.e: Up to adolescence
Up to adolescence
Up to adolescence

sen.j: 1869年7月12日、久原庄三郎（1840-1908）の四男として、現在の山口県萩市に生まれた。
sen.e: He was born on July 12, 1869 as the forth son of Shozaburo KUHARA (1840-1908) in present-day Hagi City, Yamaguchi Prefecture.
He was born on July 12, 1869 as the forth son of Shozaburo KUHARA (1840-1908) in present-day Hagi City, Yamaguchi Prefecture.
He was born on July 12, 1869 as the forth son of Shozaburo KUHARA (1840-1908) in present-day Hagi City, Yamaguchi Prefecture.

sen.j: 久原家は、網元や廻船問屋を営む素封家。
sen.e: The Kuhara famiy was a wealthy family; they were a master of fishermen and Kaisen donya (wholesaler in port).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The Kuhara famiy was a wealthy family; they were a master of fishermen and Kaisen donya (wholesaler in port).
The Kuhara famiy was a wealthy family; they were a master of fishermen and Kaisen donya (wholesaler in port).

sen.j: 房之助が生まれた頃は、醤油醸造業を営んでいた。
sen.e: When Fusanosuke was born, they ran soy sauce brewing business.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: When Fusanosuke was born, they had run soy sauce brewing business.
sen.cmt: 文法（時制）を修正しました
sen.e: When Fusanosuke was born, they had run soy sauce brewing business.

sen.j: 父の庄三郎は、藤田家から久原家に養子入りした人だった。
sen.e: His father Shozaburo married into the Kuhara family from the Fujita famly.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: His father Shozaburo married into the Kuhara family from the Fujita famly.
His father Shozaburo married into the Kuhara family from the Fujita famly.

sen.j: 藤田伝三郎の兄に当たる。
sen.e: Shozaburo is an older brother of Denzaburo FUJITA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Shozaburo was an older brother of Denzaburo FUJITA.
sen.cmt: 「分割処理する」とありますが、日本語が分割されていませんでしたので、分割しました
sen.e: Shozaburo was an older brother of Denzaburo FUJITA.

sen.j: なお、庄三郎は伝三郎が「藤田伝三郎商会」（後の藤田組、現在のDOWAホールディングス）設立の際には共同経営者として名前を連ねている。
sen.e: When Denzabur established "Denzaburo Fujita Shokai" (later Fujita Gumi, current DOWA Holdings), Shozaburo's name was listed as a partner.
When Denzabur established "Denzaburo Fujita Shokai" (later Fujita Gumi, current DOWA Holdings), Shozaburo's name was listed as a partner.
When Denzabur established "Denzaburo Fujita Shokai" (later Fujita Gumi, current DOWA Holdings), Shozaburo's name was listed as a partner.

sen.j: 1885年に東京商業学校（現一橋大学）を卒業した。
sen.e: In 1885, he graduated from Tokyo Shogyo Gakko (Tokyo Commercial College) (currentry Hitotsubashi University).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In 1885, he graduated from Tokyo Shogyo Gakko (Tokyo Commercial College) (currentry Hitotsubashi University).
In 1885, he graduated from Tokyo Shogyo Gakko (Tokyo Commercial College) (currentry Hitotsubashi University).

sen.j: 1886年に慶應義塾に入学し、1889年に同本科を卒業する。
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: He entered Keio Gijuku in 1886 and graduated from the regular course in 1889.
sen.cmt: 「分割処理する」とありますが、日本語が分割されていませんでしたので、分割しました。また、これ以降、日本語と英語が全て一行ずつずれていますので、修正しました。
sen.e: He entered Keio Gijuku in 1886 and graduated from the regular course in 1889.

sen.j: 1890年、貿易を志して森村市左衛門の森村組に入社する。
sen.e: He entered Keio Gijuku in 1886 and graduated from the regular course in 1889.
He aspired to engage in trading and joined Ichizaemon MORIMURA's Morimura Gumi in 1890.
sen.cmt: 英語が一行ずれていますので修正しました
sen.e: He aspired to engage in trading and joined Ichizaemon MORIMURA's Morimura Gumi in 1890.

sen.j: しかし、叔父藤田伝三郎と結びついていた井上馨の命令で、叔父の藤田組に入る。
sen.e: He aspired to trade and joined Ichizaemon MORIMURA's Morimura Gumi in 1890.
However, he joined his uncle's Fujita Gumi with an order of Kaoru INOUE who was connected with the uncle Denzaburo FUJITA.
sen.cmt: 英語が一行ずれていますので修正しました。併せて文法も修正しました。
sen.e: However, he joined his uncle's Fujita Gumi with an order of Kaoru INOUE who was connected with the uncle Denzaburo FUJITA.

sen.j: 1891年に小坂鉱山に赴任する。
sen.e: However, he joined his uncle's Fujita Gumi with an order of Kaoru INOUE who connected with the uncle Denzaburo FUJITA.
In 1891, he was assigned a new post at Kosaka Mine.
sen.cmt: 英語が一行ずれていますので修正しました
sen.e: In 1891, he was assigned a new post at Kosaka Mine.

sen.j: 新技術の導入により、業績を拡大して行った。
sen.e: In 1891, he was assigned a new post at Kosaka Mine.
By the introduction of new technology, their business improved and expanded.
sen.cmt: 英語が一行ずれていますので修正しました。併せて文法も修正しました。
sen.e: By the introduction of new technology, their business improved and expanded.

sen.j: 実業家時代
sen.e: As an industrialist
sen.cmt: 英語が一行ずれていますので修正しました。併せて文法も修正しました。
sen.e: As an industrialist

sen.j: 1903年に藤田組を退社する。
sen.e: As a industrialist
He left Fujita Gumi in 1903.
sen.cmt: 英語が一行ずれていますので修正しました
sen.e: He left Fujita Gumi in 1903.

sen.j: 1905年に茨城県の赤沢銅山を買収し、日立銅山と改称する。
sen.e: He left Fujita Gumi in 1903.
He purchased Akazawa Copper Mine in Ibaraki Prefecture in 1905, and renamed it Hitachi Copper Mine.
sen.cmt: 英語が一行ずれていますので修正しました。併せて文法も修正しました。
sen.e: He purchased Akazawa Copper Mine in Ibaraki Prefecture in 1905, and renamed it Hitachi Copper Mine.

sen.j: 1910年に日立製作所を設立した（1920年に株式会社化）。1912年に久原鉱業所（現ジャパンエナジー）を設立して社長となる。
sen.e: He purchased Akazawa copper mine in Ibaraki Prefecture in 1905, and renamed Hitachi copper mine.
In 1910, he founded Hitachi, Ltd. (it was transformed into a joint stock company in 1920).
sen.cmt: 英語が一行ずれていますので修正しました。また、「分割処理」しているにも関わらず、日本語が分割されていませんでしたので、分割しました
sen.e: In 1910, he founded Hitachi, Ltd. (it was transformed into a joint stock company in 1920).

sen.j: 1912年に久原鉱業所（現ジャパンエナジー）を設立して社長となる。
sen.e: In 1910, he founded Hitachi, Ltd. (it was transformed into joint stock company in 1920).
In 1912, he founded Kuhara Kogyosho (present Japan Energy Corporation) and became the president of the company.
sen.cmt: 英語が一行ずれていますので修正しました
sen.e: In 1912, he founded Kuhara Kogyosho (present Japan Energy Corporation) and became the president of the company.

sen.j: 鉱山経営を足がかりにして企業を拡大して行った。
sen.e: In 1912, he founded Kuhara Kogyosho (present Japan Energy Corporation) and became the president of the company.
The enterprise expanded using mining operation as a steppingstone.
sen.cmt: 英語が一行ずれていますので修正しました
sen.e: The enterprise expanded using mining operation as a steppingstone.

sen.j: こうして、造船業、肥料生産、商社、生命保険を傘下とする久原財閥を形成する。
sen.e: The enterprise expanded using mining operation as a steppingstone.
In this way, the Kuhara Zaibatsu was formed with group companies in shipbuilding, fertilizer production, trading and life insurance business.
sen.cmt: 英語が一行ずれていますので修正しました。併せて文法も修正しました。
sen.e: In this way, the Kuhara Zaibatsu was formed with group companies in shipbuilding, fertilizer production, trading and life insurance business.

sen.j: しかし、短兵急に事業を拡大したために無理が災し、大正末期に中核だった久原鉱業を義兄の鮎川義介に譲渡する。
sen.e: In this way, the Kuhara zaibatsu was formed with the shipbuilding industry, fertilizer production, trading company, and life insurance under jurisdiction.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: However, it became difficult to continue the business in its original form due to too rapid expansion, and Kuhara Mining, which was a core industry, was transferred to Yoshisuke AYUKAWA, his brother-in-law, in the end of Taisho period.
sen.cmt: 英語が一行ずれていますので修正しました。併せて文法も修正しました。
sen.e: However, it became difficult to continue the business in its original form due to too rapid expansion, and Kuhara Mining, which was a core industry, was transferred to Yoshisuke AYUKAWA, his brother-in-law, in the end of Taisho period.

sen.j: 同社は日産自動車の基礎となる。
sen.e: However, because the business was expanded hastily, Kuhara Mining, which was a core industry, was transferred to Yoshisuke AYUKAWA, his brother-in-law, in the end of Taisho period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The company formed the foundation of Nissan Motor.
sen.cmt: 英語が一行ずれていますので修正しました。併せて文法も修正しました。
sen.e: The company formed the foundation of Nissan Motor.

sen.j: 政治家時代
sen.e: As a statesman
sen.cmt: 英語が一行ずれていますので修正しました
sen.e: As a statesman

sen.j: 昭和に入ると、政界に進出する。
sen.e: As a statesman
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In Showa period, he went into politics.
sen.cmt: 英語が一行ずれていますので修正しました
sen.e: In Showa period, he went into politics.

sen.j: 立憲政友会公認で旧山口一区から衆議院議員総選挙に立候補した。
sen.e: In Showa period, he went into politics.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: He ran for a member of the House of Representatives at general election as a Rikken Seiyukai anointed candidate from former Yamaguchi First Electoral District.
sen.cmt: 英語が一行ずれていますので修正しました。併せて文法も修正しました。
sen.e: He ran for a member of the House of Representatives at general election as a Rikken Seiyukai anointed candidate from former Yamaguchi First Electoral District.

sen.j: 当選した。
sen.e: He ran for a member of the House of Representatives at general election as a Rikken Seiyukai anointed candidate from former Yamaguchi First Electoral District.
He was elected.
sen.cmt: 英語が一行ずれていますので修正しました
sen.e: He was elected.

sen.j: 田中義一内閣の逓信大臣、立憲政友会幹事長を歴任した。
sen.e: He was elected.
He served as the Minister of Communication at Giichi TANAKA Cabinet and the Secretary-General of Rikken Seiyukai.
sen.cmt: 英語が一行ずれていますので修正しました。併せて文法も修正しました。
sen.e: He served as the Minister of Communication at Giichi TANAKA Cabinet and the Secretary-General of Rikken Seiyukai.

sen.j: 政治的には、親軍派に位置した。
sen.e: He served as the Minister of Communication at Giichi TANAKA Cabinet and the secretary-general of Rikken seiyukai.
sen.cmt: 親軍派:定訳不明一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Politically, he was promilitary.
sen.cmt: 英語が一行ずれていますので修正しました。併せて誤訳も修正しました。
sen.e: Politically, he was promilitary.

sen.j: 中国大陸進出を主張し、「一代で巨万の富を築いた自分は超人である」と固く信じた。
sen.e: Politically, he was with Shingun (Imperial Guards) group.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: He insisted on advancing to the Chinese Continent and strongly believed "I am a superman who established millions of wealth on my own.."
sen.cmt: 英語が一行ずれていますので修正しました。併せて誤訳も修正しました。
sen.e: He insisted on advancing to the Chinese Continent and strongly believed "I am a superman who established millions of wealth on my own.."

sen.j: 又、日本の政党を一つにし、超人である自分がその政党を率いることが日本にとって最善だと考えた。
sen.e: He asserted to advance to the Chinese continent and strongly believed "I am a superman who established millions wealth in my time."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Moreover, he believed that Japanese political parties should be united and he, the super man, should be the head of the party for the best of the Japanese future.
sen.cmt: 英語が一行ずれていますので修正しました。併せて誤訳も修正しました。
sen.e: Moreover, he believed that Japanese political parties should be united and he, the super man, should be the head of the party for the best of the Japanese future.

sen.j: 「一国一党論」を唱えて憲政一新会など小会派の取り込みを推進した。
sen.e: Moreover, he believed that Japanese political parties should be united and he, the super man, should be the head of the party for Japanese future.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: He advocated "one country one party" and promoted initiatives to win over minor political parties, such as Kenseiisshinkai.
sen.cmt: 英語が一行ずれていますので修正しました。併せて文法も修正しました。
sen.e: He advocated "one country one party" and promoted initiatives to win over minor political parties, such as Kenseiisshinkai.

sen.j: しかし、二・二六事件に連座して一旦政界への影響力を喪失した。
sen.e: He advocated "one country one party" and promoted to enclose the minor political parties, such Kenseiisshinkai.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: However, he was involved in February 26th Incident and once lost influence in the political world.
sen.cmt: 英語が一行ずれていますので修正しました。併せて文法も修正しました。
sen.e: However, he was involved in February 26th Incident and once lost influence in the political world.

sen.j: しかし、その後鳩山一郎に接近して影響力を回復。
sen.e: However, he was involved in February 26th Incident and once lost influencing power to the political world.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Then however, he approached Ichiro HATOYAMA and regained political influence.
sen.cmt: 英語が一行ずれていますので修正しました
sen.e: Then however, he approached Ichiro HATOYAMA and regained political influence.

sen.j: 1939年に立憲政友会が分裂すると鳩山らに推されて総裁に就任。
sen.e: Then however, he approached Ichiro HATOYAMA and regained political influence.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: When Rikken Seiyukai was split in 1939, he assumed the position of the president with the recommendation of Hatoyama and others.
sen.cmt: 英語が一行ずれていますので修正しました。併せて文法も修正しました。
sen.e: When Rikken Seiyukai was split in 1939, he assumed the position of the president with the recommendation of Hatoyama and others.

sen.j: すると「立憲政友会正統派」（久原派）と称して、中島知久平が率いる革新派（中島派）に対抗した。
sen.e: When Rikken seiyukai was split in 1939, he assumed the position of the president with the recommendation by Hatoyama and others.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Then, claiming themselves as "orthodox Rikken Seiyukai" (Kuhara Group), he confronted the reformists (Nakajima Group) headed by Chikuhei Nakajima.
sen.cmt: 英語が一行ずれていますので修正しました。併せて文法も修正しました。
sen.e: Then, claiming themselves as "orthodox Rikken Seiyukai" (Kuhara Group), he confronted the reformists (Nakajima Group) headed by Chikuhei Nakajima.

sen.j: 総裁就任後は又もや挙国一致政党解消論を主張した。
sen.e: Then, claiming themselves as "orthodox Rikken seiyukai" (Kuhara group), he confronted the reformists (Nakajima group) headed by Chikuhei Nakajima.
sen.cmt: 挙国一致政党解消論:定訳不明
sen.e: Even after the inauguration as President, he asserted the national unity and political party dissolution theory.
sen.cmt: 英語が一行ずれていますので修正しました。併せて文法も修正しました。
sen.e: Even after the inauguration as President, he asserted the national unity and political party dissolution theory.

sen.j: 権謀術数に長け、政界の黒幕と呼ばれた。
sen.e: Even after the inauguration, he asserted the national unity and political party dissolution theory.
He was a master schemer and called a wirepuller in politics.
sen.cmt: 英語が一行ずれていますので修正しました
sen.e: He was a master schemer and called a wirepuller in politics.

sen.j: 敗戦後、戦犯容疑を受けるが不起訴となった。
sen.e: He was a master schemer and called a wirepuller in politics.
After the defeat in the war, he was suspected of being a war criminal, but the case was dropped.
sen.cmt: 英語が一行ずれていますので修正しました。併せて文法も修正しました。
sen.e: After the defeat in the war, he was suspected of being a war criminal, but the case was dropped.

sen.j: 第二次大戦後
sen.e: Post World War II
sen.cmt: 英語が一行ずれていますので修正しました
sen.e: Post World War II

sen.j: 公職追放解除後は、日中・日ソ友好に努めた。
sen.e: Post World War II
After the purge was lifted, he worked hard to strengthen ties between Japan and China as well as Japan and the Soviet Union.
sen.cmt: 訳し漏れですので補足しました
sen.e: After the purge was lifted, he worked hard to strengthen ties between Japan and China as well as Japan and the Soviet Union.

sen.j: 2回結婚しており（最初の妻が鮎川義介の妹・キヨ）、妾腹の子を含めると3男10女計13人の子に恵まれた。
sen.e: He married twice (his first wife was Kiyo, younger sister of Yoshisuke AYUKAWA) and had 13 children, three sons and ten daughters, including concubine's children.
He married twice (his first wife was Kiyo, younger sister of Yoshisuke AYUKAWA) and had 13 children, three sons and ten daughters, including concubine's children.
He married twice (his first wife was Kiyo, younger sister of Yoshisuke AYUKAWA) and had 13 children, three sons and ten daughters, including concubine's children.

sen.j: 長女は元衆議院議長・石井光次郎に、三女は大隈重信の孫・大隈信幸に、四女は元東京急行電鉄社長・五島昇に嫁いだ。
sen.e: His first, third and fourth daughter married former chairman of House of Representatives Mitsujiro ISHII, Shigenobu OKUMA's grand sonNobuyuki OKUMA and former president of Tokyu Corporation Noboru GOTO, respectively.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: His first, third and fourth daughter married former chairman of House of Representatives, Mitsujiro ISHII, Shigenobu OKUMA's grand son, Nobuyuki OKUMA and former president of Tokyu Corporation, Noboru GOTO, respectively.
sen.cmt: 文法（コンマの語法）を修正しました
sen.e: His first, third and fourth daughter married former chairman of House of Representatives, Mitsujiro ISHII, Shigenobu OKUMA's grand son, Nobuyuki OKUMA and former president of Tokyu Corporation, Noboru GOTO, respectively.

sen.j: 九女と十女は米国人と結婚している。
sen.e: His ninth and tenth daughter married Americans.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。[アメリカ合衆国と結婚している。]→[米国人と結婚している。]に変更しました
sen.e: His ninth and tenth daughter married Americans.
His ninth and tenth daughter married Americans.

sen.j: 1965年1月29日、白金 (東京都港区)の自邸（現・八芳園）で死去した。
sen.e: On January 29, 1965, he died at his own residence (currently Happo-en) in Shirakane (Minato Ward, Tokyo).
On January 29, 1965, he died at his own residence (currently Happo-en) in Shirokane (Minato Ward, Tokyo).
sen.cmt: 「白金」の読み方が誤っていましたので修正しました
sen.e: On January 29, 1965, he died at his own residence (currently Happo-en) in Shirokane (Minato Ward, Tokyo).

sen.j: 享年96。
sen.e: His age at death was 93.
His age at death was 96.
sen.cmt: 誤訳ですので修正しました
sen.e: His age at death was 96.
